title: OSSA v0.3.0 Manifest Schema
description: Open Standard for Scalable AI Agents (OSSA) v0.3.0 - Unified Task Schema. Supports Agent (agentic loops with LLM), Task (deterministic workflow steps), and Workflow (composition of Tasks and Agents) kinds Includes Agent-to-Agent Messaging Extension.

apiVersion.description: OSSA API version (v0.3.0+ supports Task and Workflow kinds)

kind.description: Resource type: Agent (agentic loops), Task (deterministic steps), or Workflow (composition)

runtime.description: Runtime-specific capability bindings (for Task and Workflow kinds)

name.description: Resource identifier (DNS-1123 subdomain format for Kubernetes compatibility)

labels.description: Key-value labels for organization and filtering

TaskSpec.description: Specification for deterministic, non-agentic workflow steps (kind: Task)

type.description: Execution type: deterministic (pure function), idempotent (safe to retry), transactional (all-or-nothing)

entrypoint.description: Entry point for execution (class::method, function name, or script path)

capabilities.description: Abstract capabilities this task requires (bound at runtime)

input.description: JSON Schema for task input validation

output.description: JSON Schema for task output validation

dependencies.description: Other tasks or agents this task depends on

ref.description: Reference to dependency (file path or name)

preconditions.description: Conditions that must be true before task execution

postconditions.description: Conditions that must be true after task execution

fallback_task.description: Reference to fallback task on failure

include_input.description: Log input data (caution: may contain sensitive data)

AgentSpec.description: Specification for agentic loops with LLM (kind: Agent) - inherits from v0.2.9. Either 'role' or 'prompts.system.template' is required.

WorkflowSpec.description: Specification for workflow composition (kind: Workflow) - composes Tasks and Agents into executable pipelines

inputs.description: JSON Schema for workflow input validation

outputs.description: JSON Schema for workflow output validation

context.description: Shared context available to all steps

group.description: Concurrency group name (workflows in same group are serialized)

cancel_in_progress.description: Cancel running workflow if new one starts in same group

timeout_seconds.description: Maximum workflow execution time in seconds

bindings.description: Map of capability names to runtime-specific handlers

mcp_server.description: MCP server name for MCP-based bindings

WorkflowStep.description: A step in a workflow - can be a Task, Agent, or control structure

ref.description: Reference to Task or Agent manifest file

inline.description: Inline Task or Agent specification (alternative to ref)

fields.description: Specific fields to extract from output

parallel.description: Steps to run in parallel (for kind: Parallel)

else.description: Steps to run if no branch condition matches (for kind: Conditional)

over.description: Expression returning array to iterate over

steps.description: Nested steps (for Loop and Conditional kinds)

retryable_errors.description: Error codes that should trigger retry

continue_on_error.description: Continue workflow even if this step fails

goto.description: Step ID to jump to on error (for action: goto)

compensation.description: Compensation step to run on error

labels.description: Step labels for filtering and organization

JSONSchemaDefinition.description: JSON Schema definition for input/output validation

provider.description: LLM provider - literal value or environment variable with default (e.g., ${LLM_PROVIDER:-anthropic})

anyOf.description: Environment variable reference with optional default

fallback_models.description: Ordered list of fallback LLM configurations for resilience

retry_config.description: Retry and backoff configuration for transient failures

provider.description: LLM provider - literal value or environment variable

RetryConfig.description: Retry and backoff configuration for LLM calls

initial_delay_ms.description: Initial delay in milliseconds before first retry

CostTracking.description: Cost governance and allocation tracking for LLM usage

enabled.description: Enable cost tracking for this agent

budget_alert_threshold.description: Alert threshold in dollars for budget monitoring

cost_allocation_tags.description: Tags for cost allocation and chargeback (e.g., project, team, service)

type.description: Tool/trigger type: mcp (Model Context Protocol), kubernetes (K8s API), http (HTTP endpoints), api (REST APIs), grpc (gRPC), function (local), a2a (agent-to-agent), webhook (event triggers), schedule (cron triggers), pipeline (CI/CD events), workflow (status changes), artifact (file outputs), git-commit (commit outputs), ci-status (pipeline status), comment (MR/issue comments), library (reusable logic), custom

Capability.description: Capability definition - can be a simple string name or a detailed object

level.description: Autonomy level: supervised (human approval), autonomous (self-directed), fully_autonomous (no oversight)

approval_required.description: Whether human approval is required for actions

allowed_actions.description: Actions the agent is allowed to perform

blocked_actions.description: Actions the agent is explicitly blocked from

escalation_policy.description: Policy for escalating to humans or other agents

currency.description: Currency for cost tracking (e.g., USD, EUR)

context_window.description: Context window management for conversation history

types.description: PII types to detect (email, phone, ssn, api_key, etc.)

MCPExtension.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) extension for agents - supports tools, resources, and prompts

enabled.description: Whether MCP is enabled for this agent

tools.description: MCP tools (functions/actions the agent can invoke)

MCPTool.description: MCP tool definition - actions/functions the agent can invoke

description.description: Human-readable description of what the tool does

input_schema.description: JSON Schema for tool input parameters (snake_case)

inputSchema.description: JSON Schema for tool input parameters (camelCase - MCP SDK convention)

MCPResource.description: MCP resource definition - read-only context and data sources

description.description: Description of the resource and its contents

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource content

MCPPrompt.description: MCP prompt definition - templated messages and workflows

description.description: Human-readable description of the prompt purpose

arguments.description: Template arguments that can be substituted

description.description: Description of what this argument represents

PublishedChannel.description: Channel that an agent publishes messages to

Command.description: RPC-style command that an agent accepts
